metadata.title: CVE-2023-2269 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A denial of service problem was found, due to a possible recursive lockingscenario, resulting in a deadlock in table_clear in drivers/md/dm-ioctl.cin the Linux Kernel Device Mapper-Multipathing sub-component.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-244-generic - 4.4.0-244.278
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-244-generic - 4.4.0-244.278
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-244-lowlatency - 4.4.0-244.278
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-216-generic - 4.15.0-216.227~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-216-generic - 4.15.0-216.227~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-216-lowlatency - 4.15.0-216.227~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-kvm - 4.4.0-1123.133
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1160-aws - 4.4.0-1160.175
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1160-aws - 4.15.0-1160.173~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1169-azure - 4.15.0-1169.184~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1154-gcp - 4.15.0-1154.171~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-oracle - 4.15.0-1123.134~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-244.278').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-216.227~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.133').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1160.175').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1160.173~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1169.184~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1154.171~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.134~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
